eligibility:
Eligibility for the programme is a pass with a minimum of 70% at the +2 level (Karnataka PUC / ISC / CBSE / State Boards) in the Commerce stream from any recognised Board in India.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Accounting skills to analyze business transactions Knowledge of core commerce domains Develop new business ideas Exposure to Digital Skills Leadership skills through co-curricular and extracurricular activities Industry exposure
what_learn: What you will learn? Understanding of core disciplines of commerce to support strategic decision-making Transform business ideas into value-generating enterprises Research and analytical skills for data-driven solutions Experience learning in a diverse environment Professional certifications from CISI-UK and CMA-USA NGO and Summer internship Embark on diverse career paths in fields such as accounting, finance, marketing, human resources, and more.
modules: Modules Financial and Computerized Accounting Business and Corporate laws Business Economics Year 1 Principles and Practices of Banking Human Resource Management Corporate and Cost Accounting Entrepreneurship and Financial management Business Analytics Year 2 Community Engagement Healthful Living Taxation Laws Investment Analysis and Portfolio Management Research Methodology Year 3 Business Ethics and Corporate Governance Corporate Internship Project International Business Quantitative Techniques for Decision Making Research Project Year 4 Business Policy and Strategic Management Specialisation in marketing and Human resource management
career: Career prospects Diverse careers across various sectors of the business world. Work in different designations such as financial analysts, accountants, marketing managers, human resource specialists Starting and managing business ventures. Pursuing postgraduate studies for career advancement in India or outside India. Pursuing roles in government agencies related to finance, commerce, and economic policy.
